result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Neil G Bullion

records.addlTxt: Laboratory report filed by the State.

1:40 PM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Neil G Bullion not in court.  Court notes the matter was set for 1:30 and it is now 1:40 pm and the defendant has failed to appear.  Court also notes there was a WCS non-compliance report filed in this matter noting the defendant has failed to comply with WCS monitoring.  State requests a capias be issued and bail be revoked and/or forfeited.  Court will issue a capias and orders bail be forfeited.

Ext Code #3
Bail jumping on underlying Waukesha County cases 21CF1004, 21CF1533 & 21CF1557.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 9/2/2022 received and filed.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance report dated 08-24-2022 received and filed.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:29 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Neil G Bullion in court with attorney Anna M Kees.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kees provides an update, she is requesting to withdraw as counsel and notes new counsel will be appointed through the PD's office.  Defendant advises that he will be seeking private counsel.  Court will grant Atty. Kees' oral motion to withdraw as counsel.  Court notes the PD's office does not have to appoint new counsel as defendant has advised he will be retaining private counsel.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:06 AM Defendant Neil G Bullion in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: May 18, 2022 Preliminary Hearing filed by Court Reporter Michelle M. Strehl.

ADDRESS INFO for Neil G Bullion
Current: 2405 Springdale Rd, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 05-24-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188
Arraignment on June 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.

09:40 AM Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Neil G Bullion in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.  

Parties are prepared to proceed to a preliminary hearing.  
City of Waukesha Police Officer Daniel Jackson sworn in and testified on direct by Attorney Sitzberger.
Cross examination by Attorney Kees.
State rests.
State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
Attorney Kees requests a date for arraignment.
Court sets an arraignment date back before Commissioner Court.  
Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Ricardo Tapia as counsel of record for the defendant.
Preliminary hearing on May 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

01:17 PM Defendant Neil G Bullion in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
